channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds of Israeli soldiers were badly wounded in Gaza. Here's what saved them
item.description: More than 500 Israeli soldiers have survived serious injuries fighting in Gaza, according to the military, thanks largely to lessons learned and advan...

item.title: She felt abandoned — until a teacher's hug reminded her she wasn't alone
item.description: When she was in the sixth grade, Tanya Eby's world was unraveling. One day, overcome with grief, she cried in class — and her teacher, Mrs. Welch, wra...

item.title: Moldova's pro-EU party wins clear parliamentary majority, defeating pro-Russian groups
item.description: Moldova's pro-Western governing party won a clear parliamentary majority, defeating pro-Russian groups in an election that was widely viewed as a star...

item.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
item.description: The jumping spider pet market is booming, particularly with women. And for many, the journey to spider enthusiast began as an arachnophobe.

item.title: Top Congressional leaders head to White House ahead of shutdown deadline
item.description: After canceling an earlier meeting, President Trump is planning to meet with a bipartisan group of Congressional leaders on Monday. Congress must pass...

item.title: Hurricane Humberto and Tropical Storm Imelda threaten Bermuda and Bahamas
9/28: CBS Weekend News
item.description: At least 2 killed in Michigan church shooting; The rescue dog that runs ultramarathons

item.title: Death toll rises to four after Michigan church shooting and arson attack
item.description: The attacker drove a vehicle into the church during a service and opened fire, before being killed himself.

item.title: Starting school can be hard for young kids. Here’s how to help with separation anxiety
Moldova's pro-EU party defeats pro-Russian groups in key election
item.description: The election was widely viewed as a geopolitical choice for Moldovans between a path to the European Union or a drift back into Moscow's fold.

item.title: Singapore denies entry to exiled HK pro-democracy activist
item.description: Nathan Law's presence "would not be in national interests", Singapore authorities say.

item.title: Senate returns as lawmakers stare down government shutdown
item.description: The Senate returns to Washington on Monday with less than two days to fund the government amid a stalemate between Democrats and Republicans on the pa...

item.title: The Indian superstar whose political rally turned fatal for dozens
item.description: At least 40 people died over the weekend in a crowd crush at a political rally organised by Vijay's party.

item.title: Denmark bans all civilian drone flights ahead of European summit
item.description: Denmark is one of several European countries that have reported "drone incidents" in recent weeks.

item.title: Maps show Tropical Storm Imelda as it's forecast to become hurricane
item.description: Imelda is the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season and is expected to strengthen into a hurricane Tuesday.

item.title: Cable car crash kills 8 monks on way to mountain meditation
item.description: The 13 monks had crowded into the small makeshift cable car as they headed to meditation units atop a mountain within the monastery, officials said.

item.title: Moldova's pro-EU party wins vote mired in claims of Russian interference
item.description: The election was seen as critical for Moldova's EU path, and President Maia Sandu warned the country's future was in danger.

item.title: Gunman opens fire at Michigan church and sets it ablaze, killing at least 4 and wounding 8
item.description: An ex-Marine smashed a pickup into a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints church in Michigan, opened fire and set the building ablaze during a ...
